sentences.en: Change all existing Snapshot Agents to use the selected profile.
sentences.cn: 用选定的配置文件来修改已有的全部快照代理程序.

sentences.en: During a call, press the Snapshot button to send a snapshot.
sentences.cn: 在呼叫过程中, 按snapshot键发送一幅快照.

sentences.en: Each spin network resembles a snapshot, a frozen moment in the universe.
sentences.cn: 每个自旋网络就像一张快照, 即宇宙中某个冻结的瞬间.

sentences.en: Enable databases for transactional ( includes snapshot ) or merge replication.
sentences.cn: 使数据库能够用于事务复制 ( 包含快照 ) 或合并复制.

sentences.en: He had a snapshot of his girl friend.
sentences.cn: 他有一张他女朋友的快照.

sentences.en: I told her about the snapshot, how I'd carried it all through the war.
sentences.cn: 我告诉她关于那张照片的事, 战争中我是如何设法一直带在身边的.

sentences.en: Let me take a snapshot of you guys, so friends back home can see you.
sentences.cn: 让我给你们大家拍张快照，这样家里的朋友们可以看到你们。

sentences.en: Only the last snapshot send or receive is hold in memory.
sentences.cn: 只有最后一次发送或接收的快照保存在内存中.

sentences.en: Send or receiving a new snapshot overwrite the previous image.
sentences.cn: 发送或接收一幅新的快照会覆盖前面的图象.

sentences.en: Some systems may be able to do atomic snapshot of many volumes.
sentences.cn: 不过有些系统可能能自动做到多卷快照.

sentences.en: The book has to be a snapshot of the situation at the time of writing.
sentences.cn: 本书在编写时只能是对这种情况的简要反应.

sentences.en: The interviews present a remarkable snapshot of Britain in these dark days of recession.
sentences.cn: 这些访谈生动地展现了英国在黑暗的萧条时期的概貌。

sentences.en: The letters give us a snapshot of his life abroad.
sentences.cn: 这些信件使我们对他在海外的生活约略有所了解.

sentences.en: The view here pop up menu appear with snapshot already highlight.
sentences.cn: 出现Viewhere弹出菜单,同时Snapshot已变亮.

sentences.en: This snapshot function is usually represented by the pair - distribution function g ( r ) when suitably normalized.
sentences.cn: 这个瞬时函数经过适当的归一通常可以表示为偶分布函数g ( r ).

sentences.en: This snapshot hasn't printed very well.
sentences.cn: 这张快照印出来不太清楚.

words.tran_cn: [摄]快照，快相；急射，速射；简单印象

trans.tran_cn: （快照）照片，独立的印象，简单印象，简介，急射，速射
trans.tran_en: a photograph taken quickly and often not very skilfully
